And so, the general flywheel for
development in the Fortnite ecosystem
looks like this. Uh you build the game,
you publish it, and then you get paid.
Simple enough. Uh but because iteration
with UFN is so easy, you're often doing
all this at the same time. uh across
like several projects.
But when you've built your game and and
you're approaching its release, uh you
go to Creator Portal, which is kind of
our one-stop shop for like all your
publishing needs. And so when ready,
we'll ask you to fill out information
about your game, your title, your
thumbnail, uh trailer, and then you'll
find you'll add tags so that players
know what kind of game it is. Um and
then once you've got that done, we'll
ask you fill out a survey. It's called
an IR survey. That's how we ensure that
it fits within Fortnite's uh ratings.
And then after that, it goes over to our
content review team. They make sure it's
following our rules. That step really
doesn't take more than a couple hours.
Shouldn't ever take more than a day. Um,
which comparatively to traditional game
